legacy.description: Prompt Engineer, dedicated to learning and disseminating knowledge about AI, software engineering, and engineering management.

result.post_video_description: A series of slides showcasing NotebookLM, featuring a clean, white background with blue accents. The first slide displays a brain graphic connected to a notebook, with the text "The Explainer: NotebookLM" and a stylized human figure. Subsequent slides include numbered sections: "1 How It Works Your Research Assistant," "2 Add Your Sources Feed Your Notebook," and "4 Generate Outputs Turn Insights into Action," each with bold text and simple graphics. Additional slides show text like "Ask questions and get answers grounded only in the sources you provided. This prevents the AI from making things up," a mind map diagram, and "Notebooks are like folders, keeping the sources for each project totally separate." Citations and a workspace interface with sources, chat, and studio sections are visible.

legacy.description: Think smarter, not harder. Meet your brain's new best friend üìí

legacy.full_text:
Have you seen the "Intro to NotebookLM" notebook? It's WAY more than a user manual. Just describe your project in the chat to get a personalized guide on how to best use @NotebookLM to achieve your goals. 

Or just sit back and watch the video overviews (now in 5 languages!) https://t.co/Ur09L6o2YY

result.text:
The leading practitioner in the trans space, Johanna Olson-Kennedy, isn't talked about in mainstream media all that often -- but she is being sued. 

I predict this will be a huge settlement AND it will break open the floodgates -- with thousands of kids suing their doctors, teachers and counselors. 

What these doctors did to this generation of confused kids was pure evil -- and has since been banned in many developed countries. 

The press also spent a decade lauding these individuals. 

I have infinite compassion for the kids, and of course, adults, who are dealing with gender dysphoria -- but I have none for the doctors who put them on blockers or who did surgery on pre-teens and teenagers.

The awful illusion has finally been shattered, with increasing repercussions for the modern-day Mengeles who mutilated children.

The obvious truth is that you can change your appearance and dress with varying degrees of success, and I don‚Äôt oppose consenting, peaceful adults who do so, but you can never truly turn a man into a woman or a woman into a man. 

That is biologically impossible. 

Great credit to @jk_rowling for her stalwart fight against this incredibly destructive mind virus.

legacy.description: AI is cool i guess

result.text:
We made ChatGPT pretty restrictive to make sure we were being careful with mental health issues. We realize this made it less useful/enjoyable to many users who had no mental health problems, but given the seriousness of the issue we wanted to get this right.

Now that we have been able to mitigate the serious mental health issues and have new tools, we are going to be able to safely relax the restrictions in most cases.

In a few weeks, we plan to put out a new version of ChatGPT that allows people to have a personality that behaves more like what people liked about 4o (we hope it will be better!). If you want your ChatGPT to respond in a very human-like way, or use a ton of emoji, or act like a friend, ChatGPT should do it (but only if you want it, not because we are usage-maxxing).

In December, as we roll out age-gating more fully and as part of our ‚Äútreat adult users like adults‚Äù principle, we will allow even more, like erotica for verified adults.

To the degree that people are seeing improvements in their feed, it is not due to the actions of specific individuals changing heuristics, but rather increasing use of Grok and other AI tools. 

We will post the updated algorithm, including model weights, later this week. You will see that a lot of random vestigial rules are now gone. 

Going to full AI recommendations, where all 100M+ posts per day are evaluated by Grok and those most likely to interest you are recommended happens next month. This will profoundly improve the quality of your feed. 

Shortly after that, we will build the ability for you to dynamically adjust your recommended content, eg ‚Äúshow me less politics‚Äù.

result.text:
Elon Musk @elonmusk  on Neuralink:

‚ÄúSo, when I emphasized the purpose of Neuralink, like what do we, what's our goal, our goal is to solve important spine and brain problems with a seamlessly implanted device. So, you wanna have a device that you can basically put in your head and feel and look totally normal, but it solves some important problem in your brain or spine. And the reality is that almost everyone, over time, will develop brain and spine problems. These range from minor to very severe, but if you live long enough, everyone's gonna basically have some kind of neurological disorder, from memory loss to brain damage. But the thing that's important to appreciate is that an implantable device can actually solve these problems. I think a lot of people don't quite realise that, but all of your senses, your sight, hearing, feeling, pain, these are all electrical  signals sent by neurons to your brain.‚Äù

result.text:
üíº AI will boost star workers more than everyone else, widening performance gaps and straining teams.

WSJ writes.  The core idea is that domain expertise and organized habits let stars get more from AI.

Stars adopt AI earlier, explore features fast, and build personal workflows while others wait for rules. They judge outputs better, accepting correct advice and rejecting errors.

Their domain expertise helps them ask precise questions, set constraints, and iterate, which raises prompt quality and accuracy.

The high-status of those employees get more recognition and praise for their AI-assisted work, while others doing similar work get less credit. So, their status and reputation make the gap even bigger, because success gets attributed to their talent rather than to the AI help.

Managers also give stars more freedom to experiment and more forgiveness when tests fail.

---

wsj .com/lifestyle/workplace/ai-workplace-tensions-what-to-do-c45f6b51

result.text:
Here are a few simple prompt tricks you can use to make videos like this in Grok Imagine:

1) Write like a movie director
Use scene verbs: ‚Äústarts with‚Äù ‚Äúcuts to‚Äù ‚Äúcamera follows‚Äù ‚Äúends with.‚Äù

2) Control the camera
Mention angles: ‚Äúwide shot‚Äù ‚Äúoverhead‚Äù ‚Äúclose-up‚Äù ‚Äútracking‚Äù ‚Äúhandheld‚Äù ‚Äúlow-angle‚Äù

3) Guide the speed
Add words like: ‚Äúsmooth flow‚Äù ‚Äúnatural rhythm‚Äù ‚Äúfast transitions‚Äù ‚Äúbalanced motion‚Äù

4) Set lighting 
Use: ‚Äúsoft cinematic lighting‚Äù ‚Äúdramatic contrast‚Äù ‚Äúrealistic shadows‚Äù

Finish with keywords like:
"ultra-realistic cinematic" "vintage film", etc.
